subject: Football
Assaults
organizations: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey
lead_paragraph: An assault charge against a Rutgers football assistant will be dropped if he completes anger management counseling, lawyers said.Prosecutor Steven Rubin said the July 14 altercation between the assistant head coach Chris Demarest and his girlfriend in a bar was more an argument than an assault.In court Saturday, Demarest’s lawyer, John Azzarello, said Demarest became angry when he had to pay a $2,000 tab for a birthday party thrown at the bar for his girlfriend. He was seen grabbing and pushing the woman, whom the police described as having cuts and bruises on her arms.Azzarello said Demarest had attended four sessions with a private counselor and would be required to attend more sessions.
